title: Green Salad Recipe
description: This green salad is hearty, vibrant, and easy to make. With assorted greens, veggies, and deli meat — this versatile salad is a meal in itself!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Green Salad Recipes Mixed Greens Salad Recipes Green Salad 4.7 (20) 10 Reviews 9 Photos This green salad is good for a side dish or a meal on its own. I make it often for my family and they always enjoy it. Submitted by Allrecipes Member Updated on May 15, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 9 9 9 9 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings ½ cup chopped onion ½ cup chopped green bell pepper 2 (10 ounce) packages mixed salad greens 4 thinly sliced chicken deli meat, chopped 1 tomato, chopped ¼ teaspoon onion powder 3 dashes garlic powder 2 pinches salt and ground black pepper to taste 3 tablespoons balsamic vinaigrette salad dressing Directions Gather the ingredients. AllRecipes / Ana Cadena Place onion and bell pepper in a microwave-safe bowl; heat in microwave on high until soft, about 1 to 2 minutes. Set aside to cool. AllRecipes / Ana Cadena Combine onion, bell pepper, salad greens, deli meat, and tomato in a large salad bowl. Sprinkle with onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper; toss well to mix. AllRecipes / Ana Cadena Pour on salad dressing; toss well and serve. AllRecipes / Ana Cadena Enjoy! AllRecipes / Ana Cadena I Made It Print 59 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 47 Calories 2g Fat 5g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 47 % Daily Value * Total Fat 2g 3% Saturated Fat 0g 2% Cholesterol 3mg 1% Sodium 163mg 7% Total Carbohydrate 5g 2% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 2g Protein 3g 5% Vitamin C 22mg 24% Calcium 45mg 3% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 303mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Green Salad 01 of 09 Photo by  AllRecipes / Ana Cadena 02 of 09 Photo by  Ana 05/06/2024 Such an easy and tasty salad to make! Really enjoyed having the chopped chicken deli meat for that extra protein. 03 of 09 Photo by  Cynthia Ross 06/09/2020 Simple... but SOOO good! Fresh veggies are in season. It’s the perfect summer salad. Substituted shredded carrot for the deli meat. Great recipe! 04 of 09 Photo by  manella 01/10/2018 A great basic salad you can add to. I put in Avocado, egg,celery, cuke,tomatoe, green onion, spinach, ice burg lettuce and chicken. Tossed with EEOV and white vinegar, little pepper but no salt. I also added cubes of Goat Cheese. 05 of 09 Photo by  kellieann 05/20/2011 This was very good. I left out the onion and bell pepper and used fresh garlic instead of garlic powder. 06 of 09 Photo by  Holly J Chadwick 05/11/2011 I added boiled egg and cheese...YUM! 07 of 09 Photo by  Nichele 06/07/2010 08 of 09 Photo by  Nichele 06/07/2010 09 of 09 Photo by  Osider760 04/26/2010 Salads are great. I mean I put in onion,grape tomatoes, shredded carrots, celery,tuna and crutons along with the lettuce and dressing. You can add or subtract. I like to go thru the fridge and see what might be close to going bad and then use it in a salad. You can add fruit and nuts. Anything that you think you might like to use, but i warn you to try it by makin a little bit first to see if you will like it so you dont waste a lot of time and ingredients on something that does not do well with something else. The possibilities are endless. 1 You’ll Also Love Wonderful Raspberry Walnut Dinner Salad 52 Ratings Tri-Pepper Salad 16 Ratings James' Fire Salad 5 Ratings Strawberry and Mandarin Salad 56 Ratings Authentic Lebanese Fattoush 31 Ratings Purslane, Cherry Tomato, and Cucumber Salad 1 Rating Chelsey's Strawberry Salad with Poppy Seed Dressing 4 Ratings Dandelion Salad 22 Ratings Orange Almond Mixed Green Salad 7 Ratings Citrus Salad 6 Ratings Fresh Tomato Salad 112 Ratings Kale Salad Recipe 105 Ratings Pretty Pomegranate Salad 4 Ratings Pear and Pomegranate Salad 75 Ratings Tomato Cucumber Salad 159 Ratings Brown Rice Belgian Endive Salad 7 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
